Build Identifier: Mozilla XULRunner 1.9.2.13 - 20101206143738

CSS's "overflow: hidden" command should hide the scroll for the listbox. But it doesn't happen.
The only way to do it, is adding the CSS to listboxbody element, which is deprecated, as stated in https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XUL/Deprecated//Defunct_Markup

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a listbox with css property "overflow:hidden;"
Actual Results:  
The scroll still shows up.

Expected Results:  
The scroll should no more show up.
comments.author: brito.pro@gmail.com

comments.text:
That page is misleading as it lists internal elements (such as listboxbody) as if they were deprecated when they are not.

That said, one should be able to hide the scrollbar without having to use internal elements.
comments.creator: enndeakin@gmail.com
